newsitem.title: USA: Nebraska corn improves, soybeans unchanged.
newsitem.headline: Nebraska corn improves, soybeans unchanged.

text.p: Condition of the Nebraska corn improved slightly during the week ended Sunday versus the previous week, while soybeans were mostly unchanged, according to the Nebraska Agricultural Statistics Service.
Corn was rated 35 percent excellent, 50 good, 12 fair, two poor and one very poor. Thirty-five percent of the crop was dented versus 30 a year ago and the 52 average.
Corn development was about eight days behind normal in most areas. Grey leaf spot was reported in southern and eastern fields.

Soybeans were rated 28 percent excellent, 59 good, 12 fair and one poor. Two percent of the crop was turning color versus five a year ago and 20 average. About 97 percent were setting pods versus 95 a year ago and 97 average.
Sorghum was 30 percent excellent, 53 good, 15 fair, one poor and one very poor. Twenty-six percent was turning color versus 17 a year ago and the 41 average.
Winter wheat seeding was two percent finished, the same as a year ago but behind three percent average.
Topsoil moisture was rated four percent surplus, 78 percent adequate and 18 short. Subsoil moisture was rated four percent surplus, 84 adequate and 12 short.
